newsitem.title: USA: Northwest Airlines bans disruptive passenger.
newsitem.headline: Northwest Airlines bans disruptive passenger.

text.p: Northwest Airlines said Thursday it had banned a man from flying on any of its aircraft after he punched a pilot earlier this month.
The man, from New York state, attacked a Northwest pilot without provocation in Detroit Metropolitan Airport on Jan. 6, the airline said, without naming him.

It said it had sent him a letter saying he would be banned "from boarding any future flight operated by our airline; furthermore, we will advise other airlines with which we maintain cooperative agreements of our decision and the background that led to it."

Published reports at the time quoted the FBI as saying a 28-year-old man from Geneseo, New York, became angry when the pilot would not take his ticket and told him to wait for a gate agent. The man came around a counter and punched the pilot.
The pilot suffered a black eye, the accounts said, and flight 1173 to White Plains, New York, was delayed for nearly two hours.
Northwest spokesman John Austin said the ban was the first by Northwest "at least in modern, contemporary times," but other airlines had taken similar action.
